title.@value: Episode of harmful use of synthetic cannabinoids

definition.@value: An episode of use of a synthetic cannabinoid that has caused damage to a personâ€™s physical or mental health or has resulted in behaviour leading to harm to the health of others. Harm to health of the individual occurs due to one or more of the following: (1) behaviour related to intoxication; (2) direct or secondary toxic effects on body organs and systems; or (3) a harmful route of administration. Harm to health of others includes any form of physical harm, including trauma, or mental disorder that is directly attributable to behaviour due to synthetic cannabinoid intoxication on the part of the person to whom the diagnosis of single episode of harmful use applies. This diagnosis should not be made if the harm is attributed to a known pattern of synthetic cannabinoid use.

label.@value: Harmful pattern of use of synthetic cannabinoids
Episode of harmful use of synthetic cannabinoids
